messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 29
messages.messageBody:
<<<<Cry for me. My mother used to send me his column
cut out of the
newspaper all
the time (to help with my parenting). I've since cut
out communication
with
her. Life is sweeter.

Kelly>>>>

Oh Kelly,
I'm sorry for your rift. Even though "Life is sweeter"
without her, it's sad that it has to be that way.

Meghan (sending big hugs)

__________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 29
messages.msgSnippet: ... These people were in Washington State, and it wasn t any kind of family or cultural tradition.  It was made up, just saying mommy backwards.  My kids have
messages.messageBody:
>
>Tia, I thought Mimi's were a Southern thing!! Never heard it before moving
>down here.

These people were in Washington State, and it wasn't any kind of family or
cultural tradition. It was made up, just saying mommy backwards. My kids
have an Oma, which is German.

>And we have a holiday baby too (another New Year's baby) and I'm sure that's
>part of what prompted him to ask for the special day. We started out by
>calling it a Trevor day...then moved into the half Birthday thing.
>It's a great day because there is no pressure on me to do decorations or
>anything. It's simple, but fun.

My sister and I always got half birthdays because we are 4 1\2 years and
one day apart. We just got a small present on our half birthday to take
some of the sting away from watching the other one get lots of stuff.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 29
messages.msgSnippet: I really hope I m doing this message stuff right....I ve never been on an e-mail list like this so I m not sure. Anyway... Tia, I thought Mimi s were a
messages.messageBody:
I really hope I'm doing this message stuff right....I've never been on an
e-mail list like this so I'm not sure.
Anyway...
Tia, I thought Mimi's were a Southern thing!! Never heard it before moving
down here.
And we have a holiday baby too (another New Year's baby) and I'm sure that's
part of what prompted him to ask for the special day. We started out by
calling it a Trevor day...then moved into the half Birthday thing.
It's a great day because there is no pressure on me to do decorations or
anything. It's simple, but fun.
Karin,
Nidoking left Pensacola around 1:30pm!!
Hope he doesn't give the postmaster too much trouble.
Ren
